name: consolidated
content:
consolidated adjective
(MADE STRONGER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
made stronger and more certain: He was re-elected for another four years and with his power consolidated.
More examplesFewer examplesAs media power becomes consolidated , the potential for abuse becomes more serious.

consolidated adjective
(JOINED)
(of businesses) joined to make a single organization: the controlling company and its consolidated subsidiaries. The industry is highly consolidated and virtually void of competition.
(of financial results etc.) combined in order to create a more simple or effective whole: consolidated trading/accounts Consolidated revenues increased by 64% to $207.2 million. See
consolidate
